Default.description: PDM_CLK = 32 MHz / 31 = 1.032 MHz. Nominal clock for RATIO=Ratio64.

1280K.description: PDM_CLK = 32 MHz / 25 = 1.280 MHz. Nominal clock for RATIO=Ratio80.

MODE.description: Defines the routing of the connected PDM microphones' signals

Stereo.description: Sample and store one pair (Left + Right) of 16bit samples per RAM word R=[31:16]; L=[15:0]

Mono.description: Sample and store two successive Left samples (16 bit each) per RAM word L1=[31:16]; L0=[15:0]

EDGE.description: Defines on which PDM_CLK edge Left (or mono) is sampled

LeftFalling.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on falling edge of PDM_CLK

LeftRising.description: Left (or mono) is sampled on rising edge of PDM_CLK

GAINL.description: Left output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters) 0x00    -20 dB gain adjust 0x01  -19.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x27   -0.5 dB gain adjust 0x28      0 dB gain adjust 0x29   +0.5 dB gain adjust (...) 0x4F  +19.5 dB gain adjust 0x50    +20 dB gain adjust

GAINR.description: Right output gain adjustment, in 0.5 dB steps, around the default module gain (see electrical parameters)

RATIO.description: Selects the ratio between PDM_CLK and output sample rate. Change PDMCLKCTRL accordingly.
Selects the ratio between PDM_CLK and output sample rate

ENABLE.description: Enable or disable the CRYPTOCELL subsystem

HOST_CRYPTOKEY_SEL.description: Select the source of the HW key that is used by the AES engine

K_DR.description: Use device root key K_DR from CRYPTOCELL AO power domain

HOST_IOT_KPRTL_LOCK.description: This write-once register is the K_PRTL lock register. When this register is set, K_PRTL can not be used and a zeroed key will be used instead. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

This register is the K_PRTL lock register. When this register is set, K_PRTL can not be used and a zeroed key will be used instead. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

Disabled.description: K_PRTL can be selected for use from register HOST_CRYPTOKEY_SEL

Enabled.description: K_PRTL has been locked until next power-on reset (POR). If K_PRTL is selected anyway, a zeroed key will be used instead.

HOST_IOT_KDR0.description: This register holds bits 31:0 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain. Reading from this address returns the K_DR valid status indicating if K_DR is successfully retained.

Write: K_DR bits 31:0 Read: 0x00000000 when 128-bit K_DR key value is not yet retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain Read: 0x00000001 when 128-bit K_DR key value is successfully retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain

HOST_IOT_KDR1.description: This register holds bits 63:32 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

HOST_IOT_KDR2.description: This register holds bits 95:64 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

HOST_IOT_KDR3.description: This register holds bits 127:96 of K_DR. The value of this register is saved in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain.

HOST_IOT_LCS.description: Controls lifecycle state (LCS) for CRYPTOCELL subsystem

LCS.description: Lifecycle state value. This field is write-once per reset.

LCS_IS_VALID.description: This field is read-only and indicates if CRYPTOCELL LCS has been successfully configured since last reset

Invalid.description: A valid LCS is not yet retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain

Valid.description: A valid LCS is successfully retained in the CRYPTOCELL AO power domain

DPMEN.description: Enter/exit deep power-down mode (DPM) for external flash memory.

MODE0.description: Mode 0: Data are captured on the clock rising edge and data is output on a falling edge. Base level of clock is 0 (CPOL=0, CPHA=0).

MODE3.description: Mode 3: Data are captured on the clock falling edge and data is output on a rising edge. Base level of clock is 1 (CPOL=1, CPHA=1).

SCKFREQ.description: SCK frequency is given as 32 MHz / (SCKFREQ + 1).

DPM.description: Deep power-down mode (DPM) status of external flash.

Disabled.description: External flash is not in DPM.

READY.description: Ready status.
QSPI peripheral is ready. It is allowed to trigger new tasks, writing custom instructions or enter/exit DPM.

BUSY.description: QSPI peripheral is busy. It is not allowed to trigger any new tasks, writing custom instructions or enter/exit DPM.

SREG.description: Value of external flash device Status Register. When the external flash has two bytes status register this field includes the value of the low byte.

DPMDUR.description: Set the duration required to enter/exit deep power-down mode (DPM).

ENTER.description: Duration needed by external flash to enter DPM. Duration is given as ENTER * 256 * 62.5 ns.

EXIT.description: Duration needed by external flash to exit DPM. Duration is given as EXIT * 256 * 62.5 ns.

OPCODE.description: Opcode that enters the 32-bit addressing mode.

WREN.description: Send WREN (write enable opcode 0x06) before instruction.

Enable.description: Send WREN.

LENGTH.description: Length of custom instruction in number of bytes.

RXDELAY.description: Timing related to sampling of the input serial data. The value of RXDELAY specifies the number of 64 MHz cycles (15.625 ns) delay from the the rising edge of the SPI Clock (SCK) until the input serial data is sampled. As en example, if set to 0 the input serial data is sampled on the rising edge of SCK.

Low.description: Task mode: Initial value of pin before task triggering is low

READY.description: Ready flag
NVMC is ready or busy

Busy.description: NVMC is busy (on-going write or erase operation)

READYNEXT.description: NVMC can accept a new write operation

Busy.description: NVMC cannot accept any write operation

WEN.description: Program memory access mode. It is strongly recommended to only activate erase and write modes when they are actively used. Enabling write or erase will invalidate the cache and keep it invalidated.

ERASEPAGE.description: Register for erasing a page in code area
Register for starting erase of a page in code area

ERASEPCR1.description: Deprecated register - Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.
Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

ERASEALL.description: Register for erasing all non-volatile user memory
Erase all non-volatile memory including UICR registers. Note that the erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the non-volatile memory can be erased.

ERASEPCR0.description: Deprecated register - Register for erasing a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.
Register for starting erase of a page in code area. Equivalent to ERASEPAGE.

ERASEUICR.description: Register for erasing user information configuration registers
Register starting erase of all user information configuration registers. Note that the erase must be enabled using CONFIG.WEN before the UICR can be erased.

ERASEPAGEPARTIAL.description: Register for partial erase of a page in code area
Register for starting partial erase of a page in code area

DURATION.description: Duration of the partial erase in milliseconds

Disabled.description: Disable cache. Invalidates all cache entries.
